item.title: Man Vs. Nature: Romantic Perspectives on Humans and Nature in William Blake's 'Spring' and John Clare's 'Crows in Spring'
item.description: This essay was written during my study of the Romanticism 1780-1840 module at UEA. On thy stupendous summit, rock sublime! [â€¦] I would recline, while Fancy should go forth (Charlotte Smith, “Beachy Head,” l.
